ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned all about coordination and what various analyses syntacticians have proposed.

Through this course, I learned about syntactic phenomena that are studied across different languages with respect to coordination, both at the sentential and morphological level: coordinate structure constraint (CSC), coordinate object drop, stylistic fronting, across-the-board movement, right-node raising, pseudo-coordination, and many more. We also examined the different analyses for these constructions: ellipsis, multidominance, and (sideward or left/rightward) movement.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Jim is an incredible instructor, and the design of this course was excellent. I loved how each week it was a different topic related to syntax of coordination, the discussion questions facilitated my learning, the reading was not overwhelming but a good amount, and the handouts in class/lecture corresponded to the reading (so it did not feel like too much information, but rather reinforcing what I already learned).
I appreciated having Einar in the course to provide judgments on Icelandic data and offer feedback/suggestions of his own during our project discussions and presentations.
It would be nice to get the readings and response questions earlier.

Strengths: Jim! He is very knowledgeable and made classes engaging and exciting. His handouts are very easy to follow and I appreciated that he let us focus on what we were interested in. Weaknesses: none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! For all the reasons I said above.
If you want to learn more about how "and" works cross-linguistically, definitely take this course!
Yes! Even if its on a different topic, I would definitely recommend taking a seminar with Jim.
